Dialogue.Line: I wouldn't had thought it possible, but somehow we've materialised, for a split second of time, and been imprisoned in some kind of force. I simply can't break its hold. Somewhere, somehow, we're being slowly dragged down.
Dragged down? To what?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Tardis materialises in a bleak landscape
Everyone is out of Roman garb and back to normal. The scanner is displaying the area outside.

Dialogue.Line: All responses negative. Air thin and static. Hmm!
Crags and pools. Oh, it's like a cemetery, it's so quiet.
Yeah, no vegetation, and I haven't seen anything move yet. We're on the moon.
Oh, what is holding us here? What force, hmm?
That looks a bit grim. Where are we?
Hmm? Oh.
Doctor, can't there just be something wrong with the Tardis?
Wrong? My boy, we've been dragged off our course. The question is, is it some natural phenomena or is it intelligent, deliberate, or for a purpose, hmm?
Oh, you'll find the answer, Doctor. You always do.
What
You'll find the answer.
Oh yes, my dear, yes, I'm confident that I can counteract it with more power. Yes. Nowm let me see.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Vicki winces
Giant ant-like creatures communicate in high-piched beeps to each other

Dialogue.Line: Good. Good, The power response is satisfactory.
Can you hear it? Listen.
Hmm?
What is it?
Oh.
Ian, Barbara, what is it?
What can you hear, Vicki?
A sort of humming. Ooo, can't you hear it?
Do you hear anything, Doctor?
Oh, she's probably heard an extra-sonic sound. You know, the thing that young people and young animals hear. Excuse me, you're in the way.
Oh, it's stopped. Barbara, it's stopped.
Are you all right now?
Yes. Yes, thanks.
Doctor? Doctor, we must get out of here.
Oh yes, I quite agree. I quite agree. The power build up is strong enough. Yes, quite satisfactory. Well now the motors. Wait a minute. Yes.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A massive woodlouse thing joins the mega-ants. The Tardis tries to dematerialise, but fails
The mega-ant noise can be clearly heard, and the Tardis wobbles. Everyone is thrown about and the scanner goes wild

Dialogue.Line: What's happening, Doctor, what's happening?
We seem to be caught! Trapped somehow. Is it some strange phenomena? There's no power in the ship. It's useless.
Ian, Doctor, look. I saw a flash behind one of those crags.
Where?
Out there. I saw it. I saw it.
Well, it's not there now.
Well I can see it's not there.
All right, all right, don't snap at each other, my dear.
I'm sorry.
You probably saw some cosmic ray which is causing the interference.
Well, I was almost. Vicki?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Vicki is still on the floor

Dialogue.Line: The noise, did it stop?
Yes. It's all gone now. Come on, I think you'd better lie down for a while.
So disturbing, all this interference.
Well, Doctor?

I can't understand it. Well, there's nothing for it, my boy, but we shall, er, it's a matter of exploration. We shall have to go and find the trouble of this interference and then learn how to counteract it.
Oh No need for the other two to come. I'll go and tell them.
Quite so.
Oh, how is she?
Oh, she's better. Oh, Doctor? Do you have such a thing as a sedative?
Of course, my dear. It's in the first aid box. You know where it is. There, it's facing you.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The DOCTOR points to a box which is among many pieces on a table in the alcove.

Dialogue.Line: Oh, yes.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: She goes to an alcove

Dialogue.Line: Oh, Doctor, what a mess. Honestly, one of these days I'm going to have a jolly good spring clean around here.
She's asleep already. Oh, er, Barbara, the Doctor and I are going outside to have a look around. Now don't worry. I won't let him out of my sight.
Nearly done, my boy, hmm?
Yes, we're ready.
You will be careful, both of you.
Yes, yes, yes, of course, of course. Now then, I want you to wear this ADJ.
This what?
It's an Atmospheric Density Jacket, to be precise. Oh, I see. Is the atmosphere a bit thin?
Yes, I'm afraid it's rather sub-normal.
Hello, what's this extraordinary thing?
Oh, these are what they technically call a respiratory compensator.
Oh, I see. A sort of advanced oxygen mask, eh?
Exactly, exactly.
Well, come on then, Doctor. Ah. How do we open the doors? We have no power.
Ah, dear, dear, dear, dear, dear. Hmm. It's one thing after another.
(Smiling.) Hmm?
Yes, well, I, er, I, er. I didn't want to, er.
Hey?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor takes his signet ring off.

Dialogue.Line: This is not merely a decorative object. Come along, come along.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor flicks some switches and waves the ring in front of an electric eye. The main doors open and he scuttles out, chuckling. Ian follows and the doors close again
Vicki is on one of the S-shaped beds

Dialogue.Line: Vicki? Here, take these. You'll feel much better.
What is it?
Oh, it's just something to make you sleep.
May I see the container.
Any aches or pains.
No, I didn't hurt myself. My ears still sting a bit, but that's all.
Well, have you decided yet whether to take the prescribed dose?
It looks a bit medieval.
What do you mean?
Well, you wouldn't like it if I wanted to stick leaches all over you, would you? And I mean, it boils down to the same thing. They might have taken these in your time, but that doesn't mean
Now, wait a minute. You can't blame my generation for everything and those pills belong to the Doctor.
He must have picked them up on his travels then because I've never seen Asperin before.
Oh, so you studied medicine at school, did you?
Yes, of course I did. Didn't you teach it?
No. We worked upwards from the three R's.
Hmm?
Reading, writing, ‘rithmatic.
Oh, it was a nursery school.
It was not.
Oh. I wish I'd gone to your school. We had to take a certificate of education in medicine, physics, chemistry.
Now, wait a minute, how old were you?
Well, I was ten when I took those.
Ten? What did you do in your time, live in the classroom?
Live in the what?
Classroom. Lecture hall.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: blank look

Dialogue.Line: How long did you study?
Almost an hour a week. We had these machines, you see, and we
All right, Vicki. Now look, you don't there's anything wrong with those pills, do you?
No.
Well, why don't you just pander to my old-fashioned medieval superstitions and take them for me?
Well.
After all, it would save me having to put make-up on and a mask and dance round a fire in order to get rid of the evil spirits.
All right!.
Good.
That's nice, Barbara. I haven't seen you wear it before.
The bracelet? No, I haven't had it for very long.
Was it a present?
Mmm.
From Ian?
No. From Nero, as a matter of fact.
From Nero? But it couldn't have been, we
I haven't had a chance to tell you before but Ian and I went to Rome also.
What? I, I
I'll tell you all about it when you wake up.
I'm not sure whether you're making it up or not. I'll ask Ian. He'll tell me.
Well you do that. He'll be back soon.
Back? He's gone outside?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor is examining a large rock

Dialogue.Line: Well, well, well. That is remarkable. Gracious. During all my travels, I don't think I've ever come across this. Magical. Isn't it extraordinary? I say, are you there, Chesterton? Chesterton? What are you doing, dear boy? Fiddling and gaping over there. Come over here and learn something. Look here, do you see what this is? Mica, hmm?
Yes, it's one of the silicates.
Capable of withstanding great heat.
Quite.
Have you got something sharp I can have for a moment, hmm?
Oh. Try my pen.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: He takes out a pen which immediately disappears

Dialogue.Line: That's very clever. Very clever. You know, you've never done that before. That's a remarkable conjuring trick.
That was no conjuring trick, Doctor. That was my pen. It vanished into thin air.
Oh, my dear man.
Vanished!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Echoes: Vanished vanished vanished vanished

Dialogue.Line: Yes, my gold pen!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Echoes: Pen Vanished My gold pen Vanished.

Dialogue.Line: Gold.
What is it Doctor?
Echoes, dear boy!
I don't mean that. I mean this place. I have a feeling.
Hmm? What sort of feeling?
I have a feeling we're being watched. Haven't you?

No. No, no, no, no, I can't see any spooks or anything. I don't think so, no. Not particularly, no. I must say that if I lived here and I heard you roaring your head off, I'd probably come down and take a look at you.
Then take my pen?
Yes, what if the power's that's got hold of the Tardis has taken your pen? Of course! Ha ha! Now then, there's something for us to solve. Come along, come along, come along.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Barbara is doing her spring-cleaning, and pauses to watch the Doctor and Ian on the scanner. Her left arm is briefly pulled towards the door

Dialogue.Line: Barbara?
Oh, sorry, did I wake you?
No. The others back yet?
No, not yet.
Is something wrong?
No. Why?
Don't know. You seem nervous.
Oh, there's there's something about this place.
I know. I wished we'd materialised in some really luxurious place, you know. Lots of lovely things to buy and eat and wear.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Barbara's arm gets pulled towards the door again

Dialogue.Line: Is your arm hurting?

No. Vicki, I know this sounds silly, but it doesn't feel as though it belongs to me. A little while ago it moved without my intending it to. Well, it's those things we don't understand that frighten us. I'm sure there's a perfectly simple explanation. I'm just letting my imag

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Barbara breaks off and leaves the room

Dialogue.Line: Doctor, look.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: It's a pyramid

Dialogue.Line: That was built.
Yes, but when? It's old, so old. Look at the state it's in.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: they walk up to it

Dialogue.Line: It's a pity we didn't bring a ladder with us. We might be able to see what's on the top.
Well, it isn't Nelson.
No. No, pity. Well, it certainly has nothing to do with holding the ship here, dear boy.
Curious, though.
Yes, it's curious. Yes, yes, yes, but we must find something more tangible, hmm? Come along, come along.
Oh, Doctor. Look.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: a small pool

Dialogue.Line: It must be water. Any form of life would need that, hey?
Wait, wait, stop.
What's the matter?
You're a little premature. Let's have your tie.
Well, I haven't got one.
I know you're not wearing one, dear boy, but the one round your middle, hmm?
I hope my pants stay up.
Yes, well that's your affair, not mine.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ian removes his tie-belt

Dialogue.Line: There you are.
Thank you. Now then.
Huh?
Yes. Let's see.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor lowers the tie into the pool.

Dialogue.Line: Just a minute!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The tie begins to smoke.

Dialogue.Line: There you are. Look, See that? Yes, there you are. You see?
Yes, I do see. You've ruined it. That was my Coal Hill School tie. You've just, er

Saved your life. You were about to have a wash in there, weren't you, or probably drink some of it? We very nearly had the remnants of a Coal Hill School teacher in there instead of his wretched old, ragged old tie.
Never mind about that. What is it?
Yes, let's see now. Now, what have we got, hmm? Echoes. Interference. Gold. And now, acid. Yes, similar properties to formic acid. Yes, it's strange, isn't it? It's very strange.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ian throws the remains of his tie back towards the pool, and a stone plops into the liquid from above. A mega-ant ducks out of sight

Dialogue.Line: Doctor! There! There's something in there! I saw a light, it it broke the surface.
A light? Is it a reflection from a planet?
No, no. It was in there. I saw something in there, I tell you.
Now, my young man. If this is your idea of revenge for that tie then I think it's a pretty poor effort.
Doctor, this is not revenge, I
Now listen, we came here to find out the source of interference. Now I suggest we keep our minds on this subject. You're rambling on. Come along. That's it.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The mega-ant sound starts up

Dialogue.Line: What is it, Doctor?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Barbara is trying to block out the sound with her hands. Then the Tardis doors open, the console starts revolving, and her bracelet is tugged at

Dialogue.Line: No!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Finally, like a sleepwalker, Barbara leaves the Tardis and the doors close behind her

Dialogue.Line: You mean, the noises are messages?
It probably comes from some sentient thing, or a machine operated by it. We must find the source of this interference. Now come on.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The console is still turning as Vicki wakes up gently

Dialogue.Line: Barbara? Barbara?
Barbara?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The doors are open again

Dialogue.Line: Barbara, where are you? Barbara! Barbara!
Barbara. Barbara.
That's Vicki. Something's wrong back at the ship.
They've probably left the doors open. Come on.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They run, Ian ahead of the Doctor, when

Dialogue.Line: Look out!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ian gets snared in a net that comes up from the ground

Dialogue.Line: Doctor! Don't come near, Doctor! Go back to the ship! Go back to the ship!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Meanwhile, Barbara is sleepwalking towards the acid pool

Dialogue.Line: Stand still.
It stings and hurts!
I'll go back to the ship and try and find something. Can you wait?
Yes, all right!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Tardis lurches, nearly throwing Vicki to the floor. She grabs the console and starts flicking switches. We hear the dematerialisation sound
A mega-ant's sounds make Barbara turn away from the acid pool at the last moment and walk around it instead
Ian is out cold on the ground, and the net has vanished

Dialogue.Line: Chesterton! Chesterton!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor gently touches Ian

Dialogue.Line: Ian.
Ahh! Don't touch me!
Are you all right, boy?
Oh, my face. my face. What's the matter with it?
It's a little blistered.
Oh, it's feels as is I fell into a bed of stinging nettles.
What's happened to that weed, hmm?
I don't know. It just went.
Went where?
Well, it just went. Into the air, into the ground. Oh, what a cursed place this is.
Yes, a cursed place. So barren. I wonder. Yes, cursed.
Come on, Doctor. Let's get back to the Tardis. Get something for my face.
Oh, unfortunately, I can't help you at the moment, dear boy.
What?
And I have a shock for you. The ship's gone. Vanished. (Meanwhile, Barbara is now being followed by a giant winged insect.)
There must be an answer to it, dear boy. There must be answer! They can't even get in the ship, let alone operate it. The interior of my ship is inviolable.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor suddenly clutches at his chest

Dialogue.Line: What's the matter?
It's my chest.
Can't you breathe?
Oh, yes.
Something wrong with these?
Yes, it's these ADJ coats are no use. After about an hour, they're useless.
Can we live without them?
Just about.
Let's take them off, shall we? Get used to the atmosphere, okay? All right?
Yes, yes.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ian takes the jacket off

Dialogue.Line: You can certainly tell the difference, can't you. Breathe slowly. Deeply, like a diver. Oh, it it's possible. Okay?
There, do you see those ridges? What are those ridges in the sand there? Have a look.
The Tardis.
I heard the Tardis.
It's been dragged away. Dragged away!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: and just to prove it, we see the Tardis travelling along, seemingly under its own power, but accompanied by the mega-ant noises
Vicki is struggling to keep her balance as she watches the progress on the scanner. Then a mega-ant head fills the screen
The winged creature gently takes Barbara's arm and guides her into a cave where there are others of its kind
Another of the creatures removes her gold bracelet and throws it into a pool of acid. Barbara wakes up

Dialogue.Line: My bracelet. I was. Who are you? What do you want?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They block her way out

Dialogue.Line: Stop her! Stay where you are.
Oh, those tracks have disappeared.
The ground seems firmer here.
No sign of it.
Oh, all so strange, so unnatural. I've never experienced anything in my life before like this. But we must continue with our search.
Yeah.
Take a look over there. Well, that's odd. Those are not track marks. Those are more like claw marks. Yes. Chesterton!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ian has just put his foot in an insect pupae

Dialogue.Line: Doctor.
I think we're on the right track, my boy.
Never mind about that. Look at this.
Good gracious. It's hollow.
Yes.
Yes, well preserved. Yes, a vertebrate creature, yes, highly developed, hmm!
But it's skin is more like a chrysalis.
Menoptra. Yes, does that word mean anything to you, hmm?
No, nothing. You mean you've been here before?
No, no, my boy. No, but it's this rock formation and now this creature, this object, it suggests the planet Vortis.
Vortis? What galaxy is that in?
The Isop galaxy. Yes, many light years from Earth. And yet the Vortis hasn't the moon's and here, there there are several. Look, you see? You can see for yourself.
Yes. Can't a planet attract satellites to itself, Doctor?
Oh, yes, yes, yes, but it would need a galactic explosion, you know, some kind of new force. Whether this Vortis planet has that or not, I can't be sure. Anyway, lets, come on, over here.
Help me.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Tardis is moving towards some sort of entrance

Dialogue.Line: After we'd landed, two of our party went to explore. The last thing I remember was being in the ship, the doors opening, and then, well, then you came.
Kill her.
(female) No.
A stranger must not be trusted.
(a male) You chose here when you chose to land on Vortis?
I keep telling you, we didn't choose. Our ship was forced here.
The Zarbi will treat them as enemies. If we refuse to help them, they will not survive.
Her future is no concern of ours. Hrostar, she was under the force of the Zarbi. Why did you break it?
Look, all we want to do is get away from here. These Zarbi that you seem frightened of, maybe we could help you?
Have you any weapons?
No, but we
Watch her.
If we let her go, she may tell the Zarbi where they can find us.
No.
Even if she does not wish to betray us, they will extort it from her.
There are few of us and many of the Zarbi. She offers help.
She is not to be trusted. I say kill her.
Hrostar. The Menoptra do not act without

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Barbara takes the opportunity to knock over Hrostar and run out of the cave

Dialogue.Line: Stop her! Stop her!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Barbara trips, hears the mega-ants and runs again. I suppose I should call them Zarbi now) (Elsewhere, The Doctor and Ian are walking slowly

Dialogue.Line: Strange lights in the sky.
Pulsating.
Do you think they could be natural like the aurora borealis?
No, look down there, my boy, hmm?
So that's where they've taken the ship to.
Apparently so. We've got to get down there. I wish we had more knowledge of what we were up against. Ah, this wilderness.
Doctor!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They are surrounded by Zarbi, and woodlice, which are very curious about them

Dialogue.Line: The best thing is just to stand still.
Maybe we could talk to them, make them understand?

Apart from rubbing our back legs together like some sort of grasshopper? I doubt if we could get on speaking terms with them. Stand still! Obey! These creatures on this planet are completely unknown to me. Just stand still and obey.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Zarbi start to push Ian and the Doctor forward

Dialogue.Line: Remember those claw marks.
Yes.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Tardis has come to a halt, and the scanner is blank. Then the doors open

Dialogue.Line: Ian? Doctor? Is there anybody there?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Vicki leaves
Vicki steps into a room made of tendrils, then Zarbi come up to her
Ian and the Doctor have arrived outside

Dialogue.Line: Doctor, look at this. It's growing.
Organic matter, reproducing itself.
Fantastic.
Yes, I wonder. I wonder how long it's taken to grow that size, eh? A hundred or two hundred years?
Doctor, if your assumption was correct and this is Vortis, what do you know of it's history?
History doesn't mean anything when you travel through space and time. All right, all right. Don't push, don't push!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: One of the Zarbi goes up to the Tardis, takes a step in then backs out again, spinning wildly. An alarm goes off. Then the Doctor and Ian enter

Dialogue.Line: My ship! The doors are open!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor rushes to the Tardis as Ian goes to Vicki

Dialogue.Line: Oh, Ian! Ian!
It's all right, Vicki, Don't worry. Where's Barbara?
I don't know. I was asleep. She must have left the ship.
What's the meaning of this, child? Who tried to get in here?
I don't know! I don't know!
What do you creatures want?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: By the acid pool, Barbara is captured by a pair of Zarbi and dragged away, holding her arms in their mandibles

Dialogue.Line: No! Ow!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: She falls to the ground

Dialogue.Line: Vrestin, use that and we shall all be destroyed. The Zarbi are all around us. If you break communicator silence, they will know where they may find us.
If we do not contact our forces, they face destruction. We must warn them of the power of the Animus.
And of the strength of the larvae gun.
The Zarbi are massed together against us.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: She changes the configuration of the crystal device, as Hrhoonda stands guard at the entrance

Dialogue.Line: Pilot party to Menoptra invasion force.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: static

Dialogue.Line: Pilot party to Menoptra invasion force. This is Vrestin. Urgent report. Urgent report.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: static.

Dialogue.Line: They are in reach of the enemy locators. They will not break communicator silence.
They will. They can echo their signals to us off satellite Taron. Menop spearhead, acknowledge reception.
Vrestin, it's no use. The cave is cutting off our signals.
Yes. We must try again from outside the cave.
If they catch us, we must break the transmitter.
Vrestin! Hrostar! The Zarbi!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Barbara is being controlled, and leading the Zarbi to the cave
Hrhoonda tries to stave off a Zarbi with his crystal spear

Dialogue.Line: Vrestin, smash the crystals. Smash the crystals, Vrestin.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A larvae grub shoots Hrhoonda

Dialogue.Line: Vrestin, run! Get away! Get away!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Vrestin escapes out the back door. Barbara enters, wearing a large wish-bone style device over her shoulders. Hrostar removes it

Dialogue.Line: We are safe for the present.
How did I get back here?
You were morphatised. Look!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: He points at the device

Dialogue.Line: I don't understand.
The Zarbi can control everyone, even us, the Menoptra, when they use that metal.
It's gold.
Don't touch!
I see. So it was the bracelet. What will they do to us?
We are to be taken to the Crater of Needles.
And then?
They will put us to work. Once there you might well wish that you had not been spared.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A larvae pushes Hrostar away from Barbara and they force him to his knees and ...

Dialogue.Line: No! (she looks away)
The Doctor's speaking to someone. Why can't we hear what he's saying?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: We can hear him.

Dialogue.Line: Who are you? We come in peace.
Peace? Is that why you attack? Where is your main force?
We are alone. We have strayed from our astral plane.
When will your invasion fleet arrive? What is its weaponry?
We are peaceful travellers from Earth.
You lie. You are the Menoptra. Our detectors show you are massing in space to attack. Speak!
I know nothing of these Menoptra.
We shall show you the fate which awaits all your ships, all your people.
Please listen to me. I have not finished my explanation…

Dialogue.Stage Direction: But the communication tube is raised and he is pushed to join Ian and Vicki. A larvae stands guard.

Dialogue.Line: Stand still.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A tendril from the wall takes aim.

Dialogue.Line: Look at that, Doctor.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: It fires at the Tardis but the energy rebounds, scattering the Zarbi.

Dialogue.Line: Look at them! Look at them!
What's happened?
It's unbelievable! Unbelievable! What did you do in the ship, child? What controls did you touch?
Well, I got thrown against the control panel and I just pressed any switches I could see. It suddenly became alive. I couldn't help it.
You have performed a miracle, my dear. You have re-aligned the fluid link. The power is back!
If only Barbara were here, we could go.
Trying to destroy my ship you will achieve nothing. Nothing! I have great secrets in my ship. We could help you.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Vrestrin is on a cliff overlooking the Zarbi headquarters. A Zarbi comes up from behind and she flies away

Dialogue.Line: If your ship is proof against our weapons, remember you are not. Tell us the secret of its armour.
Impossible. I cannot tell you why my ship withstood the fire of that gun unless you tell me the principle it's built on.
You demand my secrets? Yield yours.
What do you think the Doctor is saying?
I don't know. I hope he's asking where Barbara is.
The great secrets you speak of in your ship must be used against the invaders. In return, I offer you your freedom.
Where is the fourth member of our party, hmm? Well?
She has been taken to the Crater of Needles beyond my great web. Will your secrets look into the stars?
I don't know what you mean, but I have an astral map, if that answers your question.
Will it show where the Menoptra are massing, where they will land?
I see. So it's the Menoptra that are invading your planet, hmm?
Somewhere in space, beyond the range of our locators, they are grouping. They scatter false trails to mislead us. Their numbers are great. I am aware only of movement.
And you are not aware of their position?
This you must do.
I shall need assistance.
Bring your astral map out of your ship.
I shall need help even to do that.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: He goes back to Ian and Vicki

Dialogue.Line: Now it is their turn to receive instructions.
Tell us, Doctor. What happened?
Let us go back into the Tardis.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Zarbi block Vicki's path.

Dialogue.Line: I think they must want to keep me here as a hostage. You go in. I'll be all right.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Outside, Vrestrin has followed the Zarbi to their headquarters

Dialogue.Line: Oh. Oh, that's easier. No message from Barbara. Nothing.
I'm just beginning to relax, my boy.
Yes. Do you think that kid'll be all right out there?
Er, yes, I think so. Yes, I must do something about this face of yours.
Those beasties are keeping their distance this time.
Yes, it seems they've learnt their lesson. Here, dab some of that on your face. There's some cotton wool there.
Thanks. What do you think they are, Doctor?
Hmm?
Those things out there.
Well, to use the term of Earth, I suppose we should call them insects.
Ants? I've seen a colony of ants eat their way right through a house. That size, they could eat their way through a mountain. Why are they that big?
Size is only relative. In this rarified atmosphere, it appears that evolution has chosen that particular form of life on this planet.
Ants.
Yes.
So relentless, indestructible. What are we going to do? Have you got any ideas?

Well, it's this voice. It's this, this, this, this, this Queen of the ants, you might say. If I can only trick her into neutralising this section of this area. I want you to try and track down Barbara, hmm?
Well, all right. Did you find out where she was?
Well, it has something to do with this Crater of Needles.
Crater of Needles? Where's that?
The only clue I can give you, dear boy, it's behind a great web.
That's not much help, is it?
No, it isn't. Come on, give me a hand.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They start to wheel out the astral map - a sort of cathode ray device on a trolley

Dialogue.Line: Oh, and by the way, I want you to take a couple of these. They'll be very good for your breathing in this rarified atmosphere.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: He hands over some tablets

Dialogue.Line: Oh. What about Barbara and Vicki?
You leave Vicki to me, but when you do finally catch up with Barbara, see that she takes some. She's probably had the same experience with breathing as we have.
Mmm. Hold on a minute.
No, no, no, no. Don't unplug it. You must never do that. You must never break the time and relative dimension link. Come on.
Don't worry, Vicki. The Doctor's got something up his sleeve.
Oh, it's useless. It's useless! Come along, put me through, will you? Come along, drop this hairdryer, or whatever it is.
You have the information?
No, good gracious me, no. Some kind of force of yours has jammed my instruments and whilst it continues, I cannot use them.
I cannot suspend my functions for your experiments.
Very well, very well, take this thing away. I'm afraid we can't help you to locate your invader.
I will withhold certain forces near your instruments. If you take advantage of this, you will die.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Zarbi sink to the ground.

Dialogue.Line: Well, it appears, my boy, they've obliged. They've neutralised and completely immobilised this section.
There's one way to make sure, Doctor.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Zarbi moves when Ian tries to leave the room

Dialogue.Line: Ian!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: It turns around and sits down again

Dialogue.Line: You've done it!
It's time you left.
Yes.
Where are you going?
I'm going to find Barbara. Now, you look after the Doctor. I'll be back.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ian leaves

Dialogue.Line: Come along, cheer up, cheer up, my child. It's all right. Yes, here. Have a piece of chocolate. There you are.
I don't feel like that now.
Oh, come, come, come, come. You don't have to worry about him. He's very good at this sort of thing. Yes, he'll be back. He'll be back.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ian dives for cover in the maze of corridors as Zarbi walk past

Dialogue.Line: What are you doing, Doctor?
Hmm? Oh, I'm trying to discover a little more about this invasion fleet, my child. The more we know, the safer it will be for us.
Advance units, rendezvous.
Is that the Menoptra speaking?
I'll just turned up this booster. Wait a minute.
Menop pathfinder to leader one. Range to Vortis, one four oh.
Just turn up the recorder.
Leader to Spearhead. Lock course on bearing two six five. Speed point oh one. We jettisoned craft at altitude five above Crater of Needles. Individual descent to Sayo plateau, north of the Crater.
Did you understand any of that, hmm?
Crater of Needles, or something.
Yes. That's where they've taken Barbara.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ian is still trying to find his way out. He ends up wrestling with a Zarbi and manages to get it on it's back. Then a wall panel cuts off his escape and an alarm sounds. The Zarbi in the control get up

Dialogue.Line: It sounds as though we're under attack, my dear.
It's Ian, I know it is. They've caught him.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ian is thoroughly trapped, with a larva pointing at him. It fires its weapon, a panel swings open and he escapes to the outside
Vrestrin flies down and Ian runs off
Vicki has a gold collar on now

Dialogue.Line: You have tried to escape. Why?
I am still here.
Where is the third?
Why question me? Surely you can see our movements.
You will no longer be trusted.
Were we ever?
I can kill you all.
Yes, you can, but to what end? The information I have will die with me.
Information? Of the Menoptra invasion? Speak.
I am still collating the various readings of my instruments.
You lie. It is another of your tricks.
That is for you to decide. Am I really lying or do I possess this information, hmm?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor gestures for the Zarbi to remove the collar from Vicki.

Dialogue.Line: Away!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: It does so

Dialogue.Line: Oh! Oh, Doctor. That thing made me go to sleep.
Yes, I know, my dear, I know. I think I've earned ourselves a little breathing space.
What did you tell them?
Nothing, nothing.
Are you going to tell them about the Menoptra?

Just about as much as I ever want to. We'll see. Come, let's look busy. Now, I want you to nip into the ship and bring me back a little red box and in it is a recording compound. You'll find it on the left near the first aid kit. Go at once and come back immediately.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: She does

Dialogue.Line: Is this it, Doctor?
Oh, I said a white box, child! Do you ever think! This is one of my specimens. Look.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: He shows her the contents, a spider.

Dialogue.Line: Ew!
Now, take it back.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A Zarbi recoils at the sight of the tiny spider.

Dialogue.Line: Doctor, look! It's frightened. I'm sure it is. It's frightened!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ian and Vrestin are keeping a watch on the Zarbi HQ.

Dialogue.Line: Heron? Do you still intend to go to the Crater of Needles?
Yes, I do.
Many of my friends are enslaved there. They tear off our wings so that we may not escape.
What do you expect when you invade a planet?
Invade a planet? Vortis is ours. We the Menoptra, are reclaiming it.
Vortis is your planet?
Of course. They are returning to the Carsinome. They do not search for long.
Those things invaded your planet?
You do not know our story?
No, I don't. Tell me.
The Zarbi are not an intelligent species, but they were essential to the life pattern here. We lived at peace with them, until they were made militant by the dark power.
The dark power? What's that?
The Animus. At that time, the Carsinome appeared. Grew like a fungus. We had no weapons. We had not had the need. And by the time we sensed the danger, the Zarbi were too strong.
So you left the planet?
We had no choice.
Where did you go?
At that time, these strange moons appeared. One of them became our home, those of us who could reach it.
Can you live up there?
It is a dim, half-world and our wings grow weaker. We must return to Vortis, for when the Carsinome encircles the planet, it will be too late.
And now you're ready to attack?
No, we are not ready, but we must try.
I see. And what's your part in all this?
Three of us were sent here to prepare the way for the invasion force. Now, I am alone. I do not know.
What happened to the other two?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Vrestin whimpers.

Dialogue.Line: They were killed.
One is dead. The other was taken to the Crater
Crater of Needles.
Friend Barbara?
Yes, like friend Barbara. Vrestin, we've both lost friends. Come with me to the Crater. You know the country. We can collect your friend and mine.
There are many of my friends in the Crater of Needles.
All the more reason to go.
Yes, Heron. We will do as you say.
Good. Come on then.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ian and Vrestin have fallen into a chamber whose walls are decorated with strange symbols

Dialogue.Line: It seemed as if we fell a long, long way.
Yeah. Oh, look. Where are we?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They are surrounded by creatures using crystals for weapons
In a big crater, with tall needles of rock, wingless Menoptra work for the Zarbi

Dialogue.Line: You are breathing too fast, Harbara.
Oh, my eyes are so sore. Everything seems to to flare when I look at it.
It is the atmosphere of this planet. Rest. I will watch for Zarbi.
Are your wings healed?
I shall never fly again.
No. Why do they make us do

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A Zarbi approaches and they start work again. It leaves.

Dialogue.Line: Why do they make us heap this vegetation into the acid streams?

It is the raw material for the Carsinome, where the Zarbi live. Fed into these pools, it is drawn to the centre through underground streams, and as we pour it in, the Carsinome grows and reaches out across Vortis.
Well, what lies at the centre?
None of us have ever seen it and lived, but we call it the Animus.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A Zarbi harries them again

Dialogue.Line: Do you understand them?

No. They are just cattle. They do not have any speech nor motive of their own. Just controlled sentries. We came here to liberate them. It was disaster. Vrestin, the others, we arrived in advance of the spearhead. Our weapons proved useless. They were taken by the Zarbi who were everywhere. The three of us you met in the cave got away with the communicator, but we could not contact our spearhead.
Well, when is it due to arrive?
Soon.
And how will you overcome the Animus?
With a new invention of our scientists. It has not been tested but we have placed our faith in the Isop-tope.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A Zarbi goes past with a weapon in its mandible.

Dialogue.Line: Doctor? Why don't we use the spider now as a weapon to get out of here?
Because I think we might find it more valuable later on, child, when Ian and Barbara have returned.
Do you think it'll be safe where we put it?
Oh, a hundred percent! A hundred percent!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A Zarbi come in with a collar

Dialogue.Line: Oh no!
Use the spider, child!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: But she can't get to it in time, and she is controlled. The communication tube comes down over the Doctor's head.

Dialogue.Line: You delay. Now the child will die. Thus you will learn total obedience.
If the child dies, there'll be no reason left for me to obey. I have located your enemy. My calculations are complete.
You lie.
The Menoptra are massing on the planet Pictos.
Pictos?
It appears they are heading straight for Vortis. If you waste time in idle vengeance, in face of such an invasion, you will all be annihilated.
Where will the Menoptra land?
If I am given peace of mind for a while, I can find that out. That is, if it's not too late.
Go.
Not before the child is released.
Go now.
First, the child, hmm?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The tubes rises, a Zarbi pushes a grub away from Vicki and takes the collar off her

Dialogue.Line: Oh, Doctor, it makes you feel so dizzy.
Yes, I know, my dear, I know.
Peculiar.
I know. Be all right in a minute, hmm?
Did, did you tell that thing where the Menoptra are going to land?

Just about enough for our survival. If I tell them everything, our usefulness will be ended. Now, we've got to get out of here and I want to find a place to hide this recorder. I don't propose to make them a present of the place of attack.
There's another panic on by the looks of it.

Yes, there's no doubt they've alerted their invasion forces. They've acted very quickly on the little information that I gave them. Now, while they're busy I want you to nip back into the ship, find my walking stick and bring it straight back here. Hurry!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The alarm goes off here. A Zarbi knocks Barbara over

Dialogue.Line: (old man) It's some kind of alarm.
I hope they haven't found the

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The menoptra are herded into an enclosure
Ian and Vrestin are being 'questioned' by giant caterpillars

Dialogue.Line: We were chased! We fell!
They are too simple to understand, Heron.
Hands in there.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ian is pushed so his clasped hands dunk into some liquid which then solidifies around them. The same is done to Vrestin.

Dialogue.Line: Primitives, what is it you want from us?
Hetra.
We know that from the roof comes hate! The liquid death! Creeping destroyer of we Optera. Yet you stand upright. We will consult the chasm of lights and if you come from above, you will die!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Food is being distributed

Dialogue.Line: Hrostar, is it the invasion?
The spearhead? Yes, I think so.
Then tell us what we must do.
Nothing yet.
Do nothing? But we've waited for generations for this moment.

And it will come, but a false move and all is lost. Success depended on surprise. If this is an alert, how did they know? Your Earth friends. This man of science you tell me of? Could he be helping them?
No. No, I'm sure he wouldn't.
How, then, do they know?
Know what?
Our spearhead plan to land on Sayo Plateau, just above the crater here, to the north.
Well, that doesn't mean to say that the Doctor told them. The Zarbi must be alerted everywhere, not just here.
With the Zarbi weaponry, they will be massacred.
Are your forces armed?
With useless weapons. Our plan was for an attack on the Animus. We would have landed in secret, overcome the Zarbi, and destroyed the force that rules them by sheer force of numbers.
A suicide army.
It would have been suicide to stay where we were. The invasion had to come now. We did not choose the time. It is now, and failure will mean failure for all time.
Hrostar, the spearhead must be warned.
But how? We smashed the signalling equipment.
Look, we must get to the top of the plateau, intercept them and warn them.
Yes, we must.
There is a larvae gun pointed straight at this door.
We know.
I saw thirty or more Zarbi leaving the Crater by the great web. I do not think there will be many more left to guard us.
Look, we must try. It only needs one of us to get through.
If only we could destroy the larvae gun.
I may do that.
You? How?
I know the Zarbi.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Prapillus pushes away a spar at the back of the enclosure.
The Doctor uses his walking stick to drag the control collar across the floor while Vicki uses spider to control the Zarbi

Dialogue.Line: Good! You've got it.
Now the question is how to make it safe, hmm?
It's gold, isn't it.
Yes, there's no mistaking it, my dear. Gold and something more than gold. Gold is the symbol of power on this planet. Which brings me to an incident with Ian and his pen.
Ian and his pen?
Yes, it flew out of his hand just as he was about to give it to me. A gold pen. Now, we have got to find something to re-align this power.
What?
Yes, that is the question, isn't it?
Any sign of him?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Prapillus is hiding behind a needle as the Zarbi moves away from the larvae gun

Dialogue.Line: It's left the larvae gun. It's our chance to destroy it.
Destroy it? Well, can't we use it ourselves?
Only the Zarbi can control and fire them.
Get ready.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Prapillus throws a rock to distract the Zarbi

Dialogue.Line: Now!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Prapillus and Hrostar get the Zarbi on it's back while Barbara and Hylnia hold onto the larva's shell. Then Hrostar picks up the larva and squishes it against the crater wall

Dialogue.Line: Is the gun dead?
Yes.
I can lead us to the plateau.
Well, come on then, quickly.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The control collar is connected to the astral map

Dialogue.Line: Have you finished now, Doctor?
Yes, I think so, my dear. Well, now we know the Tardis is the opposing force, the question is, which is the stronger, hmm?
What'll happen if you're wrong?
What will happen? Well, the astral map will be ruined, of course, but I'm afraid we have no choice. Now just stand back a bit, my dear.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: He flicks a switch and, bang!

Dialogue.Line: Doctor!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor puts his hand on the collar, and nothing happens to him. A Zarbi pushes him to the communication tube

Dialogue.Line: It was nothing! Just a fuse on one of our instruments. You.
The time to complete your findings. Report.
It is still incomplete.
Excuses.
No doubt your creatures told you about the explosion. (holds up the recorder) This is what caused the delay. You must wait.
What is it you hold?
Oh, nothing, nothing. Merely a piece of damaged equipment that happened
Force on bearing two six five. Speed point oh one. We jettison craft at altitude five above Crater of Needles. Individual descent to Sayo Plateau north of the Crater.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: End of recording.

Dialogue.Line: You were in possession of the information all the time. You will be dealt with when the invasion has been repelled.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Vicki is wearing the control collar again. A second Zarbi puts another collar on the Doctor
On a ledge the bottom of a cliff.

Dialogue.Line: The plateau is just above us.
We will remain here until the spearhead arrives.
Well, at least we got here in time.
You stay on guard here, Hlynia.
The Zarbi are moving in, surrounding the plateau.
We must wait for the spearhead!
Then this Doctor must have betrayed us!
Every creature who invades our domain comes only to prey on us. You are guilty.
Throw them in the fire chasm!
Will you kill your own kind?

Listen, stranger, you are both from that wilderness above ground where the light blinds, the air chokes, where only destroyer races live and from where none of us who has gone forth has ever returned. You come foraging into our world only for new victims. Take them!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ian is knocked to his knees

Dialogue.Line: Listen! This wilderness you speak of belongs to you. We are coming in our legions to destroy the dark power and its Zarbi slaves. HETRA: The Zarbi.
They seized this planet long ago, enslaved your forebears and mine who remained. They are spreading the poisonous web of the Animus to every corner of Vortis.
As long as we kill intruders, we are safe.
Don't you understand? You are Menoptra, like this.
The Menoptra?
You speak of our Gods!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They bow to the symbols on the walls

Dialogue.Line: Your Gods? The Menoptra are your kinsmen. Your wings withered on your bodies while you crawled blindly underground, like slugs. You were born to the greatest freedom of all creatures. To peace, beauty and light!
It is death for us up there.
This is not your element.
If you throw us into the fire, you destroy your own future.
Prove what you say.
I am Vrestin, a leader of the Menoptra. We come to destroy the dark power who rules this planet.
We need your help.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Vrestin opens his wings and the Optera bow.

Dialogue.Line: Zarbi!
We're surrounded. Come on!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: But she runs into another Zarbi. Backing away, she falls against a section of rock face, which opens like a door, and they hurry through. The Zarbi and grubs cannot follow

The Zarbi are paying attention to flashing lights when Vicki opens one eye, then the other. As they are not being watched, she takes off the collar and uses it to pry the other one off the Doctor so he wakes up. Then she puts the non-functioning collar back on

Dialogue.Line: Ohh!
Shh!
My dear, you're still wearing it.
Shh! It's all right. I took a chance and put it on. You've done it. It doesn't work anymore.

Oh yes, we must capitalise on your action. Now we know the necklace no longer works on us, perhaps the force-field is being reversed. I wonder. If that is so, I can control that necklace with this power of my ring.
What power does it hold?
Now, look, look.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A Zarbi walks past them. When the coast is clear again, he puts the collar on himself.

Dialogue.Line: Now, this is what I want you to do, child. When you (whisper, whisper) Understand?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They stand still, then Vicki sways forward attracting the other Zarbi

Dialogue.Line: Oh, what's happened? Where am I? (The Zarbi sees the second collar on the floor, and bends down to it. The Doctor puts his own collar around it's neck, then leads it around with his ring.)
Splendid. Splendid.
Doctor, you've done it. How marvellous! What next?
Well, I think we shall get our friend to take us out of here. Go outside. Jeep your eyes open.
All clear.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor leads his tame Zarbi out of the room

Dialogue.Line: I thought we'd have seen more of these creatures, Doctor.
Yes, it appears they have gone to the plateau.
Well, there's one good thing. At least that spearhead'll make it easier for us to get out here.
Now, don't count your chickens, child. There's quite a lot ahead of us. Now go on, cautiously.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: This chamber is decorated, including Menoptra statues

Dialogue.Line: It's beautiful, Prapillus. Oh, it's absolutely beautiful!
It must be a Temple of Light. The ancient song-spinners of our race sang of their beauty, but I thought they could never be found again.
There are others?

So the legends say. Sewn into the craters and plateaus of Vortis, been slowly un-woven by the silence of time and their entrances long forgotten by our species. But our Gods have not forgotten us, Barbara. This was indeed deliverance.
There is no sound. The Zarbi have gone. If one of us must explore
No, not yet. They will leave guards.
All is not lost!
What are you?
Spearhead Leader Hilio.
Codeword?
Electron.
Prapillus, I brought him.
Hlynia! How?
There was a tunnel on the lower ledge where you left me. What, what happened on the plateau?
The spearhead has failed.
No! The spearhead must succeed. Which is the way back to the Plateau? I will recall my force.
No, Hilio.
(What force? From what I saw of the battle, your spearhead was completely wiped out.
Who is this creature?
Our ally.
I do not trust her.
You have no choice.
Hrostar, Prapillus, what shall we do?
Is it true? Are they all dead?
Dead, or prisoners by now.
Then our main force cannot know where to land. They too will be massacred. The Menoptra will be no more.

Hilio, the Menoptra have no wisdom for war. Before the Animus came, the flower forest covered the planet in a cocoon of peace. Our ancestors carved temples like this for resting places of our dead, but that was all the work we did. There were no other plans to make. Light was our God and we existed in light, flying above thought. Our banishment has taught us of enemies and weapons, and my captivity has taught me strategy. They tore my wings from me and I felt, as you feel, that all was lost. But if our Gods favour our survival, we must learn their lesson and use our brains and not our wings. This Earth woman we must trust, for she can show us how to exist without wings, to survive and flourish. What should we do?
Well, what would have happened if the spearhead had been successful?
Had we met with no resistance, we were to proceed to the centre of the web and destroy the Animus.
How?
With this. Our wise men designed it for use against the intelligence.
A living cell destructor?
Yes. The web, and the living thing behind it, grows and spreads its evil around Vortis. This destructor would have reversed the process, made the cells grow inwards and die.
The electron guns failed to work against the Zarbi. Would this have failed too?
Well, there's only one way to find out.
Attack the Animus. Can we reach it?
It cannot work now. We are too few.
The only alternative is to stay here, perhaps for years.
Both ways may mean our death. But hope lies in action.
Then it's decided. We attack!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ian and Vrestin have been freed from the glue

Dialogue.Line: The Optera have promised to help. Heron, can we trust them?
We have no choice.
They have strength down here. Their fears of the surface may grow too strong.
It's better than being thrown into the fire.
These tunnels breathe hate, and in the centre grows the root of evil, Poidarac!
Root?
The Animus.
Take us there.
Nemini will lead.
Keep close to me.
Come.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor, Vicki and their tame Zarbi exit the Carsinome

Dialogue.Line: Hey.
Oh! Most unpleasant! Oh well, my dear, so far, so good, hmm?
Doctor, how are we going to find the Menoptra? They could be anywhere on this planet.
Yes, the Zarbi's left here to go to the spearhead. It's just about. Yes, with luck we can follow their tracks.
Yes, look.
Let's get moving. (to the Zarbi) You may not believe it, but you nearly ended up as lost property. (the Carsinome makes a noise) And the same to you.
Oh, must have a rest, child.
You know, Doctor, I'm getting quite fond of Zombo.
What?
Zombo, it's his name. I gave it to him.
Oh, yes, I see, I see.
He's quite cute, isn't he, when he's like this.
Well, I haven't noticed it before, my dear, but since you mention it, no I don't think so.
I've told you before not to judge by appearances.
Oh, I'll buy you a collar for him at the next stop. But just you remember, child, if we lose him, there's about two hundred or more ahead of us, just like that. Now, come along, come along.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The passage is blocked by stalagmites

Dialogue.Line: Break the teeth of stone.
Oh, the air's terrible.
Yes, they are more used to it than we are, Heron.
The tunnel breathes vapour.
Not here, there.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: they go down another tunnel

Dialogue.Line: The wall is not friendly. We must break it.
What's wrong?
A silent wall. We must make m mouths in it with our weapons. Then it speak more light.
Dig, you mean? Will it stand it?
Ha! We try.
Heron!
Coming!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ian holds up some rocks to help Vrestin, then has to move quickly out of the way before they come tumbling down. The way behind them is blocked.

Dialogue.Line: Now we have to go on.
Nemini, make mouth of light.
Heron, I cannot breathe.
I know. The fall.
Breathe.
Let in more gas.
Breathe.
Dig!
Dig?
Dig!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They've drawn a plan of the Carsinome in the sand

Dialogue.Line: The best idea is still that we create a mock attack here in the south in order to draw off the Zarbi. Then whilst this is happening, one of us tries to get in the centre from the north.
It will fail. Even if it drew most of the Zarbi, it would require just one larvae gun to stop the real attack.
Then what is your idea?
I could fly over the Carsinome and try and cut my way in from above.
No, the Carsinome is strong and vigorous. It would heal itself before you could cut your way through.
Then we're left with the mock attack. It isn't perfect, I know, but it's all we have.
Very well, I will go in alone from the north.
No, I will go.
Quiet! There's someone outside.
Locks the doors!
Too late!
Hide!
If it's Zarbi, the doors will not open.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: But a Zarbi does enter.

Dialogue.Line: No! Do not attack him. He's quite harmless.
Doctor!
My dear Barbara. Where is Chesterton, hmm?
Better? It's clearing.
The vapour sleeps at our feet. Move slowly.
Nemini! Soon the mouth will appear. The walls are thin.
The liquid hate from above.
The acid pools. Get away!
No, no! She must block the mouth or we will die. (Nemini sacrifices herself to stop the acid from getting in)
It is danger that is always with us. Poidarac. It is well. Try down there.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ian pays his respects to Nemini

Dialogue.Line: Heron, They have broken the wall.
A most detailed report. Yes, it's interesting.
Will it work, Doctor?
Oh, I don't see why not, my dear. What is in the centre of the web, hmm? Do you know?
No.
No one knows. An alien from the darkness of space but the shape inside the cocoon.
But if it arrived here from another planet, surely some one must have seen it?
Our legends of it only begin when it was already thinking itself into the crannies of Vortis and the minds of the Zarbi, spreading its web.
Where does it draw its power from, hmm?
Is there is power in the magnetic pole of the planet? That is where the web has its centre.
Yes, the magnetic pole, I see, I see. You mean it draws and uses the power from the planet Vortis.
Yes, Doctor. Their theory would would explain the new moons that have appeared in the sky. They too are drawn here by this power.
Yes, I wonder why I didn't realise that before. The same force drew and holds the Tardis here. Yes, of course, it's remarkable, most interesting.
Doctor, do you intend to go ahead with the plan?
The plan? The plan. Yes, my dear, yes. Yes, but with a slight difference.
How different?
Yes, I think we'll go ahead with the mock attack as planned, that will be your responsibility, my dear. A time we shall agree to.
Yes, Doctor.
And this?
That, I shall take along with me. The girl and I will return to the Zarbi headquarters

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Hilio keeps the Isop-tope out of the Doctor's reach

Dialogue.Line: Our wise men have put all their skill into this one Isop-tope. I cannot yield it to a stranger.
Wait. Can you take the Isop-tope past the Zarbi guards in safety?
Of course. I don't see why not?
Prapillus!
Hilio, he is the first friend of the Menoptra ever to leave the Carsinome. We must trust the Doctor.
Thank you.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Hilio hands over the Isop-tope

Dialogue.Line: Thank you. I have great admiration for your wise men and their judgement. Now, my dear, is everything quite clear, hmm?
Yes, Doctor. You will return to headquarters. Once you're safely there, we start the attack to draw out the Zarbi while you make for the centre.
Precisely. Come, child.
Doctor, have we got to?
Oh, now, now, now, cheer up, cheer up. I don't particularly want to go back there myself.
It's all right. I suppose we do have the best chance. Anyway, the Tardis is still there.
Doctor?
Yes, what is it? What do you want? Excuse me. Well, what do you want, hmm?
I wondered if we could borrow this creature? I think he would be very useful in our attack.
Oh, you think so, do you?
I have made a study of the Zarbi. I think I could make use of him.
You do? Better than I?
Please, I have no wish to offend, but you don't know the Zarbi as I do.
To control him, you will have to use my ring. And that is of untold value.
And what of the value of our Isop-tope?
Is anything wrong?
No! No, my dear, no!
A small matter.
Our friend here has suggested that the creature goes along with your party.
And I was thanking the Doctor for his faith in our Isop-tope.
That's a very good idea, Doctor.
Hmm? (he gives his ring to Prapillus) Here, take it!
May I know its secret?
You may not. Use it and return it.
Forgive me.
On your life, return it.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Inside the complex, the Zarbi are all motionless

Dialogue.Line: I think you'd better take this, my child. (the Isop-tope) It'll probably be less conspicuous with you. Come on.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The wall flashes and the Zarbi burst into action

Dialogue.Line: Oh, Doctor!
Leave it me, child. Leave it to me.
Poidarac is above us now.
Heron? What should we do?
We go up.
Barbara, ready for you to give the word.
We'll wait. Make sure the Doctor has got to the control section.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: As the raiding party take up positions outside, Vicki falls away from the Doctor and the communication device descends

Dialogue.Line: You attempted escape?
We have been on a slight exploration.
You have been brought back to me.
Brought back? We came of our own free will. We are not to be subjected like the Zarbis, or terrorised like the Menoptra! We are
You are of no further use except for the way you think. I need your intelligence. You will be brought to the centre, to me!
What do they want now?
Oh, we we shall be taken to the centre, child. Try, try not to be afraid.
The Doctor will have reached the control section by now. Prapillus, we should send in the Zarbi.
Ah, you never let me have the web destructor back again, child. We may not get another chance.
Doctor, I haven't got it.
Oh yes, I gave it to you. Come along, my child, come along, come along.
It's just that I haven't got it now.
Well where is it, child?
It's in the astral map, I hid it there. **[Carsinome entrance]**.
Zarbi coming. Are we ready?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Their tame Zarbi fights another one

Dialogue.Line: Prapillus, it will throw the necklet off.
Barbara, now!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Barbara distracts the Zarbi, then the Menoptra run in the other direction and shout at it.

Dialogue.Line: Zarbi!
Zarbi!
Zarbi!
Zarbi!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Her high-pitched voice seems to confuse it, but she lures it into the Carsinome, and comes out alone

Dialogue.Line: It will return with reinforcements.
Well, that was the idea, wasn't it?
We must move into the corridors to make it more difficult for the Zarbi. They won't scatter us so easily.
I will take the first larvae gun.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The party have reached a wall with roots growing down it

Dialogue.Line: Look out! The acid again.
No Heron. It is water.
Water?
Poidarac sucks goodness from our world.
Water. It sank below the surface when the Animus choked the soil.
Well it's still there, Vrestin. All you have to do is bring it to the surface. You can grow your plants again.
If we go up we meet the blinding heart of Poidarac. I have fear. Optera, stay.
Listen, Optera. Poidarac is evil. The Menoptra are stronger than evil. The world above is good.
Vrestin, if this is a root, we can't lose our way. Why not leave them here?
No. They are descendants of my race. They can live in light. Come.
They stay. I go. If there is safety, I return for them. We go.
Hrostar?
Yes, I'm ready.
What are they doing?
The Zarbi will have larvae guns.
This is the only way we can stop them.
If it works.
Get back, Barbara!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: As a Zarbi and a larvae gun arrive, Hrostar takes the collar off the tame Zarbi and waits for the larvae gun to come closer. He manages to put the collar over the gun, but he still gets shot. The tame Zarbi runs off as Hrostar falls on the larvae, squashing it dead

Dialogue.Line: Oh! Hrostar is dead.
Then we must succeed so that Hrostar may lie at rest in the Temples of Light. Do not cry, Hlynia, there is work to do. Come.
(taking the collar from the corpse) The next gun is mine. Follow.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: This is a very organic chamber with bright light and something at its centre

Dialogue.Line: Oh, can you see it, Doctor? Can you see it?
This infernal light is too bright for my eyes.
What Vortis is, I am. What you are, I will become.
Doctor! Doctor! Leave us alone, you parasite!
Parasite? A power, absorbing territory, riches, energy. culture! You come to me.
You filthy, great spider! You won't get us because we won't move!
Do not fight against it. Approach, approach, both of you.
I mustn't move, I mustn't move.
There seems to be no end to it. Look out!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A piece of root breaks off and falls

Dialogue.Line: All right?
The blinding dark is close now.
Heron, let us rest.
No.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Barbara glances into the control room and sees the Tardis with a Zarbi guarding it

Dialogue.Line: Zarbi.
How many?
I only saw one.
With larvae guns?
No, I think he was alone.
Do not let him give the alarm, Hilio.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: But Hilio drops the collar in the struggle. Barbara picks it up and hands it to Prapillus who gets it onto the Zarbi

Dialogue.Line: This seems to be the Zarbi nest. How does the Animus control them?
Look, there!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The wall is flashing
The Animus has got the Doctor and Vicki entwined in its tendrils

Dialogue.Line: I can't, I can't struggle any more. Doctor, help me! There's no one. No chance, and it's all my fault.
What I take from you will enable me to reach beyond this galaxy, into the solar system, to pluck from Earth its myriad techniques and take from man his mastery of space.
Look out!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Menoptra struggle with the web guns in the walls. Hlynia stabs the wall with her crystal spear

Dialogue.Line: No, Hlynia!
Zarbi centre wounded! Aliens in control.
This sector seems to be paralysed.
Oh look, this is the Doctor's astral map.
Does it work?
Yes, I think so.
Can we speak to the invasion force with it?
Yes, if I can just find the right frequency. Where would you want it set?
To the planet Pictos, there.
Now, try that.
Vortis to main force. Vortis to main force. Warning, repeat, warning, Electron guns useless against the Zarbi. Isop Plateau heavily ambushed. Wait for instructions. Reply.
Either it hasn't heard, or it doesn't trust us.
Or I didn't set it right. I don't know, there's something wrong. This thing ought to light. Prapillus, look. It's the Isop-tope. The Doctor, he must have been captured.
Then we must take it to the centre ourselves.
But why would
There's no time to lose.
Hilio will take care of the Doctor.
Hilio.
Hurry!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The surface above is organic and yielding

Dialogue.Line: Give me this.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ian takes Hetra's spear and tries to cut through the roof

Dialogue.Line: It's like trying to cut your way through treacle.
The blind mouth of Poidarac will not let us through.
Heron, try.
Remember, the Destructor must be aimed at the dark side of the Animus.
Zarbi! There's no turning back. We must rush them. It only needs one of us to get through with the Destructor.
Now!
Zarbi!
Barbara!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Hilio throws the Isop-tope to Barbara, distracting the Zarbi so he and Prapillus can get through, followed by Hylnia

Dialogue.Line: Barbara! Barbara! Barbara!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Barbara then throws it to Hlynia and she gets through too

Dialogue.Line: They're not following us.
Perhaps we were expected?
This must be the centre. Give me the Isop-tope.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They rush in and are stunned by the sudden bright light

Dialogue.Line: Light!
All of you.
Light! Light! Light!
No, Hlynia, not this light! It is evil.
Barbara, the Destructor. Take it!
Barbara? Oh, Barbara!
The dark side. I must aim it at the dark side.
Approach. Approach, Earth people. Your struggles are futile.
It doesn't work! It doesn't work!
Escape is impossible. Impossible.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Behind the Animus, a familiar figure climbs up through the floor

Dialogue.Line: Ian!
You are expected too. You have not the power.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Barbara falls, with the Isop-tope pointing upwards, and the Animus sounds worried.

Dialogue.Line: Power. Master them. Master them! The universe!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The light goes, smoke pours out of the source and the creature collapses on top of it, dead

Dialogue.Line: It's dead. It's dead!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Tardis stands alone, with no Carsinome around it.
A Zarbi scrapes at the ground and a spring starts to flow, It drinks, and others join it. The Menoptra drive them off.

Dialogue.Line: Hlynia. Water. Drink, Hlynia.
Vicki. Vicki. Vicki. Vicki.
What is it?
Water!
It is! Why does it appear now?
Before the Animus, water flowed freely on Vortis. Now the evil is gone, our streams run pure again. Our vegetation will flourish. VICKI: Barbara.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Barbara is playing with a larva

Dialogue.Line: Barbara, come and look. Water.
Be strong. Be strong. The light is very good.
We fly like you?
No, but your children may fly.
We see.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Hetra tries flapping his tiny arms, and falls

Dialogue.Line: Be patient.
Without flight, how will the gods of light be kind to my people?
Vortis is strong by thought. We will work together.
If I had not lived til this time, I would have counted my life entirely wasted. Doctor, we owe you a great deal.
There's only one thing you owe me, my friend.
And what is that?
That is my ring, hmm?
Your ring? Your ring, on my life.
Thank you, thank you.
Well, they seem to be enjoying themselves up here.
The light is good.
Light is good.
Heron, will you come back to Vortis?
Oh, I doubt it, Vrestin. But, knowing the Doctor, you can never be sure.
Vrestin, have you mended the communicator?
Well, my boy, we've managed to come out of this knot unscathed.
Yes. All except my old school tie.
Yes, it's quite a problem, isn't it. It's something to do with coal, wasn't it?
Coal Hill School. An old Coal Hill School tie. Black with thin emerald green stripes on it.
Yes, yes, quite so. Quite so. Come on.
Barbara, Vicki.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: One by one they enter the Tardis, and it dematerialises

Dialogue.Line: It disappeared!

Their deeds shall be sung in the Temples of Light. Pictos shall remind us of a time as it circles Vortis. Every time it points to the Needle of the Kings, as it does now, then we shall weave songs to praise the gods of light and thank them that they sent the Earth people to save us from the Animus. Now the Zarbi larvae feed the soil, the flower forest shall grow again across Vortis. But we must not allow the forest to conceal another lurking Animus. Welcome the main force.
Vortis to main force, Vortis to main force.
Main force to Vortis. Main force to Vortis. Vrestin, where shall we land?
The dark power is dead. Fly in Menoptra to the delta of lights. We are waiting.
